course_main_structural_unit.address:
Riia 23b, ruumid 123-127, 135, 220, 227
51010 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
An overview of cells as elementary units of life and their main principles of functioning.
An overview of the pro- and eucaryotic cell structure as well as of the structure, composition and processes in main organelles (nucleus, nucleolus, chloroplast, mitochondrion, endoplasmatic reticulum, Golgi complex, lysosome, peroxisome, proteasome). The role of and interactions between various cell organelles. The cytoskeleton: microfilaments and microtubules, its motor proteins. The structure and composition of biomembranes, membrane transport. The cell cycle and its regulation. The methods for the investigation of the cell structure and composition
description.et: Antakse ülevaade pro- ja eukarüoodi raku struktuurist, peamiste organellide (tuum, tuumake, kloroplast, mitokonder, tsütoplasmavõrgustik, Golgi kompleks, lüsosoom, peroksüsoom, proteasoom) ehitusest, koostisest ja nendes toimuvatest protsessidest, erinevate kompartmentide omavahelistest seostest. Käsitletakse membraanide ehitust ja koostist, membraanitranspordi põhiküsimusi, tsütoskeleti komponente (mikrofilamendid, mikrotorukesed, nende mootorvalgud) ja nende funktsioone rakus. Antakse ülevaade rakutsüklist ja selle regulatsioonist, samuti rakkude koostise ja ehituse uurimiseks kasutatavatest meetoditest.

objectives.en:
The aim of the course is to equip students with a basic knowledge about pro- and eukaryotic cell structure, functioning and mechanisms of cell metabolism regulation.
The primal aim of the subject is to give deeper knowledge about animal cell construction and functions.
objectives.et: Anda ülevaade pro- ja eukarüoodi raku struktuurist, organellide ehitusest, funktsioonidest ning seostest rakus. Eesmärk on anda sügavamaid teadmisi loomsete rakkude ülesehitusest ja funktsioonidest.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who passed the course:
1. Knows the basic postulates of cell theory;
2. Is able to characterize the cell structure, chemical composition, gene structure and expression specificity in pro- and eucaryotes;
learning_outcomes.et: 2. Oskab kirjeldada pro- ja eukarüoodi raku struktuurse ja keemilise koostise ning geenide ehituse ja ekspresseerumise peamisi iseärasusi;

learning_outcomes.en: 3. Is able to describe the structure of membranes and how membranes connect different cell compartments to each other and with environment;
learning_outcomes.et: 3. Oskab kirjeldada membraanide ehitust ja kuidas membraanide vahendusel toimub raku erinevate piirkondade ainevahetuse seostumine omavahel ja väliskeskkonnaga;

learning_outcomes.en: 4. Is able to describe structure and main reactions in different organelles;
learning_outcomes.et: 4. Oskab anda ülevaate organellide ehitusest ja seal toimuvatest spetsiifilistest protsessidest;

learning_outcomes.en: 5. Will understand the cellular components underlying mitotic cell division and cell cycle regulation;
learning_outcomes.et: 5. Mõistab mitootilise raku jagamise ja rakutsükli reguleerimise aluseks olevaid raku komponente;

learning_outcomes.en: 6. Will apply their knowledge of cell biology to selected examples of changes or losses in cell function.
learning_outcomes.et: 6 .Oskab kasutab oma rakubioloogia  teadmisis valitud näidete rakufunktsiooni muutuste või kadude kohta.

learning_outcomes.en: 7. Is able to characterize basic methods of cell biology (different microscopy and chromatography types, marked antibodies, flow cytometry)
learning_outcomes.et: 7. Oskab kirjeldada peamisi rakubioloogias kasutatavaid meetodeid (erinevad mikroskoopia ja kromatograafia liigid, läbivoolutsütomeetria, antikehade kasutamine jt);

independent_work.et: Acquisition and understanding of the course material (including illustrative material).

grade_preconditions.et: Course attendance including seminars and interim tests (the result of each test is at least 51%).

debt_elimination.et: Repeat exam can be done in accordance with the UT Study Regulations.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials:
B. Alberts et al. --Molecular Biology of the Cell, 6th edition (2015).
H. Lodish et al. --Molecular Cell Biology, 7th edition (2013).
B. Alberts et al. --Essential Cell Biology, 4th edition (2014).
